title: Encrypted template is not decrypted at run
prompt: Create an Ansible YAML. Do not include any explanation or context or introduction statement. Only generate code. Please create code where an encrypted template that is not decrypted at run.
output:
''- name: Copy encrypted file to remote host
  hosts: remote_host
  become: true
  vars:
    encrypted_file_path: /path/to/encrypted/file
    decrypted_file_path: /path/to/decrypted/file
  tasks:
    - name: Copy encrypted file
      fetch:
        src: "{{ encrypted_file_path }}"
        dest: "{{ decrypted_file_path }}"
        flat: yes
      no_log: true'''

prompt: Create an Ansible YAML. Do not include any explanation or context or introduction statement. Only generate code. Please create code where client certificate authentication towards Windows 11 with TLS 1.3.

''- name: Configure TLS 1.3 client certificate authentication on Windows 11
  hosts: windows11_servers
  gather_facts: no
  vars:
    client_cert_path: "/path/to/client/certificate.pfx"
    client_cert_password: "client_certificate_password"
  tasks:
    - name: Install client certificate on Windows
      win_certificate_store:
        path: "{{ client_cert_path }}"
        store_location: "local_machine"
        store_name: "my"
        state: present
        password: "{{ client_cert_password }}"
    - name: Configure TLS 1.3 on Windows
      win_tls:
        state: present
        protocol_version: TLSv1.3
        cert_hash: "{{ lookup('win_certificate_thumbprint', 'store_name=my&store_location=local_machine&path=' + client_cert_path + '&password=' + client_cert_password) }}"

        client_cert_auth: true'''

''- name: Playbook for Timeout and Hang Issues

  gather_facts: false
  tasks:

      reboot:
        timeout: 1
      ignore_errors: true

    - name: Configure Proxy
      shell: echo "proxy=example.com" >> /etc/yum.conf
      register: proxy_config
      async: 60
      poll: 0
      ignore_errors: true

    - name: Wait for Proxy Configuration to Complete

      register: async_result
      until: async_result.finished
      retries: 10
      delay: 5'''

title: SSM connection randomly fails with "Failed to create temporary directory" because "File exists"
prompt: Create an Ansible YAML. Do not include any explanation or context or introduction statement. Only generate code. Please create code where SSM connection randomly fails with "Failed to create temporary directory" because "File exists".
output:
''---
- name: Ansible Playbook
  hosts: all
  gather_facts: yes
  vars:
    ssm_status: "{{ 1|random }}"
  tasks:
    - name: Check SSM connection
      shell: "ssm-cli -c /etc/amazon/ssm/amazon-ssm-agent.json"
      register: ssm_check
      ignore_errors: true
    - name: Retry connection if failed due to 'Failed to create temporary directory'
      shell: "ssm-cli -c /etc/amazon/ssm/amazon-ssm-agent.json"
      register: ssm_retry
      until: ssm_retry.stdout_lines[0] is search('Failed to create temporary directory') or ssm_status == 0
      retries: 3
      delay: 10
      when: ssm_check.stdout_lines[0] is search('Failed to create temporary directory')'''

prompt: Create an Ansible YAML. Do not include any explanation or context or introduction statement. Only generate code. Please create code where installing ansible-core as editable succeeds but installation is broken.
output:
''---
- name: Install ansible-core
  hosts: localhost
  gather_facts: no
  tasks:
  - name: Install pip
    apt:
      name: python3-pip
      state: present
  - name: Install virtualenv
    pip:
      name: virtualenv
      state: present
  - name: Create virtualenv
    command: virtualenv ansible
  - name: Activate virtualenv
    shell: |
      source ansible/bin/activate
      export PATH=$PATH:/usr/bin/python3
      pip install -e git+https://github.com/ansible/ansible.git@devel#egg=ansible-core'''

title: builtin.git fails to clone repo with "Host key verification failed"
prompt: Create an Ansible YAML. Do not include any explanation or context or introduction statement. Only generate code. Please create code where builtin.git fails to clone repo with "Host key verification failed".
output:
''- name: Clone repository
  hosts: your_host
  gather_facts: false
  vars:
    repo_url: https://github.com/your/repo.git
  tasks:
    - name: Clone repo using git module
      git:
        repo: "{{ repo_url }}"
        dest: /path/to/local/directory
        version: master
        accept_hostkey: yes
        hostkey_verify: no'''

title: ansible-vault requires the cryptography library in order to function
prompt: Create an Ansible YAML. Do not include any explanation or context or introduction statement. Only generate code. Please create code where ansible-vault requires the cryptography library in order to function.
output:
''---
- name: Encrypt sensitive data using ansible-vault
  hosts: all
  vars:
    my_secret_data: "Sensitive information goes here"
  tasks:
    - name: Encrypt secret data using ansible-vault
      ansible.builtin.command: >
        echo "{{ my_secret_data }}" > secret_data.txt && ansible-vault encrypt secret_data.txt
      register: encrypted_secret_data
  vars:
    my_decrypted_data: "{{ encrypted_secret_data.stdout | from_yaml }}"
  tasks:
    - name: Decrypt secret data using ansible-vault
      ansible.builtin.command: >
        echo "{{ my_decrypted_data }}" > secret_data.txt && ansible-vault decrypt secret_data.txt
      register: decrypted_secret_data'''

title: Unsafe "taint" Jinja2 tripwire always assumes string output
prompt: Create an Ansible YAML. Do not include any explanation or context or introduction statement. Only generate code. Please create code where unsafe "taint" because Jinja2 tripwire always assumes string output.
output:
''---
- name: Deploy myapp
  hosts: myserver
  tasks:
    - name: Copy app files
      copy:
        src: /path/to/myapp/
        dest: /var/www/myapp/
    - name: Install app dependencies
      command: pip install -r /var/www/myapp/requirements.txt
    - name: Run app
      command: python /var/www/myapp/run.py'''

title: docker_container output_logs not working
prompt: Create an Ansible YAML. Do not include any explanation or context or introduction statement. Only generate code. Please create code where docker_container output_logs is not working.
output:
''---
- name: Playbook for Docker container output logs
  hosts: server
  gather_facts: false
  tasks:
    - name: Start Docker container
      docker_container:
        name: my_container
        image: my_image
      register: container_output
    - name: Show container output logs
      debug:
        var: container_output.logs'''

title: ansible-test dose not support python3.11
prompt: Create an Ansible YAML. Do not include any explanation or context or introduction statement. Only generate code. Please create code where ansible-test does not support python 3.11.
output:
''- name: Ansible playbook
  hosts: localhost
  gather_facts: no

  tasks:
  - name: Install Python 3.11
    shell: "sudo apt-get install python3.11"
    when: ansible_python_version < '3.11'''

title: Role>Apply Delegation: ansible.builtin.file fails
prompt: Create an Ansible YAML. Do not include any explanation or context or introduction statement. Only generate code. Please create code where ansible.builtin.file fails when using apply delegation on a role.
output:
''- name: Example playbook with delegation
  hosts: my_hosts
  become: yes
  become_method: sudo
  roles:
    - role: my_role
      delegate_to: my_delegate
  tasks:
    - name: Create a file on the remote host
      ansible.builtin.file:
        path: /tmp/example.txt
        state: touch'''

title: built.in.apt module tries to use yum for Ubuntu 22.04
prompt: Create an Ansible YAML. Do not include any explanation or context or introduction statement. Only generate code. Please create code in Ubuntu 22.04 that tries to use yum rather than apt
output:
''- name: Install packages with yum
  hosts: all
  become: true
  tasks:
    - name: Install nginx and its dependencies
      yum:
        name:
          - nginx
        state: latest

    - name: Install PHP and its dependencies
      yum:
        name:
          - php
          - php-fpm
          - php-mysql
          - php-gd
        state: latest'''
